title: Walking in the Light Together
devotional:
Eliza had always loved the Saturday morning breakfasts at the church. It wasn't just the perfectly cooked scrambled eggs or the crispy bacon, but the laughter and stories that filled the air. After weeks of being on the road for work, Eliza was looking forward to reconnecting with her friends. But when she arrived, something felt off. The usual boisterous chatter was replaced by hushed tones and awkward silences. The atmosphere felt heavy, like a storm cloud hanging over the room.

She soon learned that a disagreement had erupted among some of the regular attendees. A seemingly small issue about the upcoming community garden had spiraled into a heated debate, fracturing friendships and creating divisions within the group. Eliza felt a pang of sadness. This wasn't the fellowship she knew and loved. It wasn't the place where everyone was welcome regardless of background. 

Later that evening, she reread 1 John 1:7: 'But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus, his Son, purifies us from all sin.' The verse struck her deeply. True fellowship wasn't about agreeing on everything; it was about walking in the light of Christ together, acknowledging their shared humanity and recognizing that they were more than their disagreements. 

Inspired, Eliza decided to bake a batch of her famous cinnamon rolls and bring them to the church the next day. She gathered a few others who felt similarly heartbroken by the division and they discussed the matter further. They decided that instead of taking sides, they would host a special prayer meeting specifically focused on unity and reconciliation. They acknowledged that disagreements were inevitable, but the most important thing was to make a conscious effort to forgive each other and seek understanding. The prayer meeting helped a lot and it wasn’t long before the church group was working together again.
image_description: A close-up of a wooden table with several steaming mugs of coffee and a plate of cinnamon rolls, sunlight streaming through a nearby window.
insights: 1 John 1:7 highlights that true fellowship stems from a shared relationship with God. When we walk in the light of Christ, we are connected to one another through His grace and love. This connection transcends differences and disagreements, allowing us to forgive and support each other. Colossians 3:12-14 further emphasizes this, urging believers to clothe themselves with compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience, forgiving one another as the Lord has forgiven them. Above all, love, which binds everything together in perfect harmony.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of fellowship. Help us to walk in the light of Your love, that we may have genuine connection with one another. Forgive us for the times when we have allowed disagreements to divide us. Grant us the grace to forgive and to seek understanding, that we may be a community that reflects Your love and unity to the world. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Have you experienced a breakdown of fellowship in your life? What steps can you take to restore unity and connection? How can you actively promote a spirit of forgiveness and understanding in your community?
